isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - RELAY VALVE (BENDIX R-12 AND R-14) - ASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: ASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: Prior to assembly, lubricate all O-rings, O-ring bores and any sliding surface with a silicone lubricant equivalent to Dow Corning #10.
Refer to Figure 53 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install large piston O-ring (Item 5) on piston.
Install inner and outer O-rings (Items 11 and 12) in the exhaust cover assembly.
Install the sealing ring (Item 4) on the cover.
Install piston (Item 6) in body, taking care not to damage the piston O-ring (Item 5).
Noting the reference marks made during disassembly, install the cover on the valve body and the mounting bracket on the cover.
Secure the mounting bracket and cover to the body using the four (4) capscrews and lockwashers. Tighten to 80 to 120 in-lbs. (9 to 13.3 N· m).

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 56 for all items in parentheses.

figure.caption: Figure 56. Bendix R-12 and R-14 Assembly

calloutgroup.callout1: 9. O-RING A. 1/4 I P.T. CONTROL B. 1/2 I P.T. DELIVERY C. A SUPPLY

step1.para: Install the valve retainer (Item 3) on the inlet/exhaust valve (Item 4) and install in the body.
Install the inlet/exhaust valve (Item 4) return spring (Item 5) in the body.
Install the exhaust cover assembly (Item 7) in the body, taking care not to damage the O-ring (Item 8).
While depressing the exhaust cover, install the retaining ring (Item 6). Make certain the retainer is completely seated in its groove in the body.
Install the diaphragm in the R-14 cover, making certain it is positioned between the guide ribs in the cover.
Install the service port cap nut and tighten to 150 in-lbs. (16.6 N· m).

Test valve as outlined in
SERVICE CHECKS.
